name: Biostimulant Effects on Crop Yield in Field Trials
description: This meta-analysis examines the effect of non-microbial plant biostimulants on crop yield in open-field trials. Biostimulant categories include seaweed extracts (SWE), protein hydrolysates (PHs), protein extracts (PE), humic/fulvic acids (HFA), chitosan (Chi), silicon (Si), and phosphite (Phi). Based on Li et al. 2022 (Frontiers in Plant Science 13:836702).
intervention: Plant biostimulant application (seaweed extract, humic acid, fulvic acid, protein hydrolysate, chitosan, silicon, phosphite)
typical_effect_size: +17.9% average yield increase across all biostimulant categories
important_moderators: Biostimulant type (SWE, PHs, PE, HFA, Chi, Si, Phi)
Application method (soil drench, foliar spray, seed treatment)
Soil type and organic matter content
extraction_priorities: 1. CRITICAL: Extract EVERY treatment combination separately
2. Control = untreated/no biostimulant; treatment = with biostimulant
3. If multiple rates or application timings, extract EACH vs control
5. Record biostimulant type, rate, and application method
6. Focus on FRESH YIELD as primary outcome
tc_confusion_warnings: Some papers test multiple biostimulant products - extract each vs control
Factorial designs (biostimulant x rate x timing): extract each combination
LSD is common - extract as variance measure
Watch for different units (g/plant vs kg/ha vs t/ha)

ground_truth.reference: Li et al. 2022, Frontiers in Plant Science 13:836702
